title: Getting Started with h5lite
text: h5lite package provides simple, lightweight, user-friendly interface reading writing HDF5 files. designed R users want save load R objects (vectors, matrices, arrays) HDF5 file without needing understand low-level details HDF5 C API. guide walk common use case: simulating experimental data, saving HDF5 file along metadata, reading back analysis.

title: Getting Started with h5lite
text: Think HDF5 file self-contained file system. ’s single file disk can hold organized hierarchy data. three important concepts : Groups: like folders directories. use organize data. Groups can contain groups create nested structure. Datasets: like files file system. dataset stores actual data, vector, matrix, multi-dimensional array. Every dataset resides inside group. Attributes: small, named pieces metadata can attach either groups datasets. perfect storing extra information like units, descriptions, configuration parameters. h5lite designed make working structure feel natural R user.

title: Getting Started with h5lite
text: primary function writing data h5_write(). creates dataset inside HDF5 file automatically handles: Creating HDF5 file doesn’t exist. Creating parent groups needed. Overwriting existing dataset path. Let’s start writing matrix simulated sensor readings dataset. ’s ! ’ve just created HDF5 file stored matrix . Helpful Tip: Notice name "experiment_1/sensor_readings". h5lite automatically created group experiment_1 creating dataset sensor_readings inside .
code: # A 3x4 matrix of sensor data sensor_data <- matrix(rnorm(12, mean = 25, sd = 0.5), nrow = 3, ncol = 4)  h5_write(file, "experiment_1/sensor_readings", sensor_data)

title: Getting Started with h5lite
text: default (dtype = "auto"), h5lite automatically chooses space-efficient data type can safely store numeric data. example, small integers stored int8 uint8 instead double save space. can override specifying dtype. Let’s save integer identifiers, explicitly telling h5lite use 32-bit integer type.
code: trial_ids <- 1L:12L h5_write(file, "experiment_1/trial_ids", trial_ids, dtype = "int32")

title: Getting Started with h5lite
text: default, h5_write saves single-element vectors 1-dimensional arrays. write true HDF5 scalar, wrap value () treat “-”.
code: h5_write(file, "experiment_1/run_id", I("run-abc-123"))

title: Getting Started with h5lite
text: Now ’ve written data, see ’s file?

title: Getting Started with h5lite
text: h5_ls() lists objects (groups datasets) file. default, lists everything recursively. see top-level objects, use recursive = FALSE.
code: h5_ls(file) #> [1] "experiment_1"                 "experiment_1/run_id"          #> [3] "experiment_1/sensor_readings" "experiment_1/trial_ids" h5_ls(file, recursive = FALSE) #> [1] "experiment_1"

title: Getting Started with h5lite
text: can inspect dataset’s properties without reading data. useful large datasets. h5_dim() returns dimensions R’s standard, column-major order. h5_typeof() returns underlying HDF5 storage type.
code: dim(sensor_data) #> [1] 3 4 h5_dim(file, "experiment_1/sensor_readings") #> [1] 3 4  h5_typeof(file, "experiment_1/trial_ids") #> [1] "int32" h5_typeof(file, "experiment_1/sensor_readings") #> [1] "float64"

title: Getting Started with h5lite
text: read data back R, use h5_read(). automatically handles transposing data HDF5’s row-major order R’s column-major order restores correct dimensions. Safety First: h5lite reads numeric HDF5 types (integers, floats, etc.) R’s numeric (double-precision) vectors. intentional design choice prevent integer overflow, common bug reading data systems.
code: read_sensor_data <- h5_read(file, "experiment_1/sensor_readings")  print(read_sensor_data) #>          [,1]     [,2]     [,3]     [,4] #> [1,] 24.29998 24.99721 24.08909 24.85865 #> [2,] 25.12766 25.31078 24.87634 24.72315 #> [3,] 23.78137 25.57421 24.87790 25.31449  # Verify that the object is identical to the original all.equal(sensor_data, read_sensor_data) #> [1] TRUE

title: Getting Started with h5lite
text: Attributes small pieces metadata attached datasets groups. perfect storing things like units, configuration parameters, version info. Let’s add attributes sensor_readings dataset. can list read attributes using h5_ls_attr() h5_read_attr().
code: # Add a scalar string attribute for units h5_write_attr(file, "experiment_1/sensor_readings", "units", I("celsius"))  # Add a numeric vector attribute for calibration coefficients h5_write_attr(file, "experiment_1/sensor_readings", "calibration", c(1.02, -0.5)) h5_ls_attr(file, "experiment_1/sensor_readings") #> [1] "units"       "calibration"  units <- h5_read_attr(file, "experiment_1/sensor_readings", "units") print(units) #> [1] "celsius"

title: Getting Started with h5lite
text: complex data structures, h5_write() h5_read() seamlessly save load nested R list objects. R list objects written HDF5 groups. Attributes list saved attributes corresponding group. objects inside list (vectors, matrices, etc.) saved datasets. allows perform “round-trip” complex R object, preserving structure metadata.
code: # Create a nested list with attributes my_list <- list(   config = list(version = 1.2, user = "test"),   data = list(     matrix = matrix(1:4, 2),     vector = 1:10   ) ) attr(my_list$data, "info") <- "This is the data group" attr(my_list$data$matrix, "my_attr") <- "matrix attribute"  # Write the entire list. This creates a group called "session_data". h5_write(file, "session_data", my_list)  # Read the group back into a list read_list <- h5_read(file, "session_data")  # Verify the round-trip was successful all.equal(my_list, read_list) #> [1] "Component \"config\": Names: 2 string mismatches"                                                            #> [2] "Component \"config\": Component 1: Modes: numeric, character"                                                #> [3] "Component \"config\": Component 1: target is numeric, current is character"                                  #> [4] "Component \"config\": Component 2: Modes: character, numeric"                                                #> [5] "Component \"config\": Component 2: target is character, current is numeric"                                  #> [6] "Component \"data\": Attributes: < names for target but not for current >"                                    #> [7] "Component \"data\": Attributes: < Length mismatch: comparison on first 0 components >"                       #> [8] "Component \"data\": Component \"matrix\": Attributes: < Length mismatch: comparison on first 1 components >"

title: Getting Started with h5lite
text: h5lite special support R’s unique data types.

title: Getting Started with h5lite
text: write R factor, h5lite automatically saves native HDF5 enum type, preserving integer values character labels.
code: conditions <- as.factor(sample(c("control", "treatment_A", "treatment_B"), 12, replace = TRUE))  h5_write(file, "experiment_1/conditions", conditions)  # Let's check the on-disk type h5_typeof(file, "experiment_1/conditions") #> [1] "enum"  # Read it back - it's a perfect match! read_conditions <- h5_read(file, "experiment_1/conditions")  identical(conditions, read_conditions) #> [1] TRUE

title: Getting Started with h5lite
text: store binary data, use R raw vector. stores data sequence bytes.
code: binary_blob <- as.raw(c(0xDE, 0xAD, 0xBE, 0xEF)) h5_write(file, "experiment_1/binary_config", binary_blob)  read_blob <- h5_read(file, "experiment_1/binary_config") identical(binary_blob, read_blob) #> [1] TRUE

title: Getting Started with h5lite
text: h5lite follows “overwrite--default” philosophy. write existing path, old data replaced.
code: h5_read(file, "experiment_1/run_id") #> [1] "run-abc-123"  # Overwrite with a new value h5_write(file, "experiment_1/run_id", I("run-xyz-987"))  h5_read(file, "experiment_1/run_id") #> [1] "run-xyz-987"

title: Getting Started with h5lite
text: can explicitly delete datasets, groups, attributes.
code: # Delete a single dataset h5_delete_dataset(file, "experiment_1/trial_ids")  # Delete an attribute h5_delete_attr(file, "experiment_1/sensor_readings", "calibration")  # Delete an entire group and all its contents h5_delete_group(file, "old_data") #> Warning in h5_delete_group(file, "old_data"): Object 'old_data' not found. #> Nothing to delete.  h5_ls(file, recursive = TRUE) #>  [1] "experiment_1"                 "experiment_1/binary_config"   #>  [3] "experiment_1/conditions"      "experiment_1/run_id"          #>  [5] "experiment_1/sensor_readings" "session_data"                 #>  [7] "session_data/config"          "session_data/config/user"     #>  [9] "session_data/config/version"  "session_data/data"            #> [11] "session_data/data/matrix"     "session_data/data/vector" # Clean up the temporary file unlink(file)

title: Authors and Citation
text: Daniel P. Smith. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Smith D (2025). h5lite: Simplified HDF5 Interface. R package version 0.0.0.9000, https://cmmr.github.io/h5lite/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {h5lite: Simplified HDF5 Interface},   author = {Daniel P. Smith},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {https://cmmr.github.io/h5lite/}, }

title: Simplified HDF5 Interface
text: h5lite R package provides simple lightweight interface reading writing HDF5 files. designed R users want save load common R objects (vectors, matrices, factors, data.frames) HDF5 file without needing understand low-level details HDF5 library.

title: Simplified HDF5 Interface
text: h5lite “opinionated” software prioritizes simplicity safety common use cases. handles tricky parts HDF5 automatically can focus data. Simple, R-native API: Use familiar functions like h5_read() h5_write(). need learn complex new syntax. Dimensions handled automatically. R matrices saved matrices read back matrices. Parent groups created needed (e.g., writing "group/data" works even "group" doesn’t exist). Writing existing dataset path overwrites , just like re-assigning variable. Numeric data read back double prevent integer overflow surprises. Automatic data type selection saves space default (e.g., 1:100 stored 8-bit integer). Built-, easy--use compression (compress = TRUE). Easy Installation: h5lite bundles HDF5 dependency, installation simple install.packages("h5lite"). need manage system libraries. package uses HDF5 library developed HDF Group (https://www.hdfgroup.org/).

title: Simplified HDF5 Interface
text: can install released version h5lite CRAN: Alternatively, can install development version GitHub:
code: install.packages("h5lite") # install.packages("devtools")   devtools::install_github("cmmr/h5lite")

title: Simplified HDF5 Interface
text: API designed simple predictable.
code: library(h5lite)  file <- tempfile(fileext = ".h5")

title: Simplified HDF5 Interface
text: Use h5_write() save R objects. automatically handles dimensions chooses efficient -disk data type.
code: # Write a vector h5_write(file, "data/vector", 1:10)  # Write an R matrix mat <- matrix(c(1.1, 2.2, 3.3, 4.4), nrow = 2, ncol = 2) h5_write(file, "data/matrix", mat)  # Write a 3D array arr <- array(1L:24L, dim = c(2, 3, 4)) h5_write(file, "data/array", arr)  # Write a scalar h5_write(file, "scalar_string", I("Hello!"))  # Write a factor fac <- as.factor(c("a", "b", "a", "c")) h5_write(file, "factor_data", fac)  # Write a data.frame h5_write(file, "mtcars", mtcars)

title: Simplified HDF5 Interface
text: Use h5_ls() see file structure.
code: # List all objects recursively h5_ls(file, recursive = TRUE) #> "mtcars"       "data"         "data/array"      "data/matrix"     #> "data/vector"  "factor_data"  "scalar_string"    # List only the top level h5_ls(file, recursive = FALSE) #> "mtcars"  "data"  "factor_data"  "scalar_string"

title: Simplified HDF5 Interface
text: Use h5_read() read data back R. function automatically restores correct dimensions.
code: # Read the matrix mat_in <- h5_read(file, "data/matrix") print(mat_in) #>      [,1] [,2] #> [1,]  1.1  3.3 #> [2,]  2.2  4.4  # Verify dimensions print(dim(mat_in)) #> 2 2  all.equal(mat, mat_in) #> TRUE

title: Simplified HDF5 Interface
text: can easily read write metadata using attributes.
code: # Write attributes to the "data/matrix" dataset h5_write_attr(file, "data/matrix", "units", I("meters")) h5_write_attr(file, "data/matrix", "scale", c(1.0, 1.0))  # List attributes h5_ls_attr(file, "data/matrix") #> "scale" "units"  # Read an attribute units <- h5_read_attr(file, "data/matrix", "units") print(units) #> "meters"

title: Simplified HDF5 Interface
text: Writing existing path automatically overwrites data. Use h5_delete_dataset* functions explicitly remove objects.
code: # Overwrite the vector h5_write(file, "data/vector", c(99, 100)) h5_read(file, "data/vector") #> 99 100  # Delete the dataset h5_delete_dataset(file, "data/vector")  # Delete the attribute h5_delete_attr(file, "data/matrix", "units")  # Delete an entire group and its contents h5_delete_group(file, "data")  h5_ls(file) #> "mtcars"  "factor_data"  "scalar_string"

what: When to Use Another HDF5 Package
title: Simplified HDF5 Interface
text: h5lite intentionally simple. need advanced control HDF5 features, use comprehensive package like rhdf5 (Bioconductor) hdf5r (CRAN). Use rhdf5 hdf5r need : - Work complex custom HDF5 data types supported h5lite (e.g., bitfields, references). - fine-grained control file properties, chunking, compression filters. - Perform partial /O (.e., read write small slice large -disk dataset). Use h5lite want : - Quickly safely save R matrices, arrays, objects file. - Avoid thinking low-level details.

what: Get R Class of an HDF5 Object — h5_class
title: Get R Class of an HDF5 Object — h5_class
text: Inspects HDF5 object returns R class h5_read() produce.

title: Get R Class of an HDF5 Object — h5_class
code: h5_class(file, name, attrs = FALSE)

title: Get R Class of an HDF5 Object — h5_class
text: file Path HDF5 file. name full path object (group dataset) check. attrs Controls attribute checking. TRUE character vector containing "class", function check "class" HDF5 attribute object.

title: Get R Class of an HDF5 Object — h5_class
text: character string representing R class (e.g., "numeric", "character", "factor", "raw", "list"). Returns NA_character_ HDF5 types h5lite read.

title: Get R Class of an HDF5 Object — h5_class
text: function determines resulting R class inspecting object's metadata. Groups reported "list". Datasets (integers, floats) reported "numeric" (since h5_read always returns double). String datasets reported "character". Enum datasets reported "factor". 1-byte Opaque datasets reported "raw". Compound datasets reported "data.frame". attrs set TRUE character vector containing "class", function first check HDF5 attribute object named "class". string attribute name exists, value (e.g., "data.frame") returned, taking precedence object's type.

title: Get R Class of an HDF5 Object — h5_class
code: file <- tempfile(fileext = ".h5")  # Write various object types h5_write(file, "integers", 1:5) h5_write(file, "doubles", c(1.1, 2.2)) h5_write(file, "text", "hello") h5_create_group(file, "my_group")  # Write a data.frame, which becomes a compound dataset h5_write(file, "my_df", data.frame(a = 1:2, b = c("x", "y")))  # Check R classes h5_class(file, "integers")      # "numeric" #> [1] "numeric" h5_class(file, "doubles")       # "numeric" #> [1] "numeric" h5_class(file, "text")          # "character" #> [1] "character" h5_class(file, "my_group")      # "list" #> [1] "list"  # Check the data.frame h5_class(file, "my_df") # "data.frame" #> [1] "data.frame" h5_class(file, "my_df", attrs = TRUE)  # "data.frame" #> [1] "data.frame"  unlink(file)

what: Get R Class of an HDF5 Attribute — h5_class_attr
title: Get R Class of an HDF5 Attribute — h5_class_attr
text: Returns R class h5_read_attr() produce given HDF5 attribute.

title: Get R Class of an HDF5 Attribute — h5_class_attr
code: h5_class_attr(file, name, attribute)

title: Get R Class of an HDF5 Attribute — h5_class_attr
text: file Path HDF5 file. name Name object attribute attached . attribute Name attribute.

title: Get R Class of an HDF5 Attribute — h5_class_attr
text: character string representing R class (e.g., "numeric", "character", "factor", "raw"). Returns NA_character_ HDF5 types h5lite read.

title: Get R Class of an HDF5 Attribute — h5_class_attr
text: function maps low-level HDF5 storage type attribute resulting R class. Integer/Float attributes reported "numeric". String attributes reported "character". Enum attributes reported "factor". 1-byte Opaque attributes reported "raw". HDF5 types reported NA_character_.

title: Get R Class of an HDF5 Attribute — h5_class_attr
code: file <- tempfile(fileext = ".h5") h5_write(file, "data", 1)  # Write attributes of different types h5_write_attr(file, "data", "int_attr", 10L) # 1D array of length 1 h5_write_attr(file, "data", "char_attr", I("info")) # scalar  # Check R class h5_class_attr(file, "data", "int_attr")  # "numeric" #> [1] "numeric" h5_class_attr(file, "data", "char_attr") # "character" #> [1] "character"  unlink(file)

title: Create an HDF5 File — h5_create_file
text: Explicitly creates new, empty HDF5 file.

title: Create an HDF5 File — h5_create_file
code: h5_create_file(file)

title: Create an HDF5 File — h5_create_file
text: file Path HDF5 file created.

title: Create an HDF5 File — h5_create_file
text: Invisibly returns NULL. function called side effects.

title: Create an HDF5 File — h5_create_file
text: function simple wrapper around h5_create_group(file, "/"). main purpose allow explicit file creation code. Note calling function almost always unnecessary, h5lite writing functions (like h5_write() h5_create_group()) automatically create file exist. provided convenience users prefer explicitly create file writing data .

title: Create an HDF5 File — h5_create_file
code: file <- tempfile(fileext = ".h5")  # Explicitly create the file (optional) h5_create_file(file)  # Check that it exists file.exists(file) # TRUE #> [1] TRUE  # Write to the file h5_write(file, "data", 1:10)  # Clean up unlink(file)

title: Create an HDF5 Group — h5_create_group
text: Explicitly creates new group (nested groups) HDF5 file. useful creating empty group structure.

title: Create an HDF5 Group — h5_create_group
code: h5_create_group(file, name)

title: Create an HDF5 Group — h5_create_group
text: file Path HDF5 file. name full path group create (e.g., "/g1/g2").

title: Create an HDF5 Group — h5_create_group
text: Invisibly returns NULL. function called side effects.

title: Create an HDF5 Group — h5_create_group
code: file <- tempfile(fileext = ".h5")  h5_create_group(file, "/my/nested/group")  # List all objects recursively to see the full structure h5_ls(file, recursive = TRUE) #> [1] "my"              "my/nested"       "my/nested/group" unlink(file)

title: Delete an HDF5 Attribute — h5_delete_attr
text: Deletes attribute object.

title: Delete an HDF5 Attribute — h5_delete_attr
code: h5_delete_attr(file, name, attribute)

title: Delete an HDF5 Attribute — h5_delete_attr
text: file Path HDF5 file. name path object (dataset group). attribute name attribute delete.

title: Delete an HDF5 Attribute — h5_delete_attr
text: Invisibly returns NULL. function called side effects.

title: Delete an HDF5 Attribute — h5_delete_attr
code: file <- tempfile(fileext = ".h5") h5_write(file, "data", 1) h5_write_attr(file, "data", "attr1", I("some info")) print(h5_ls_attr(file, "data")) # "attr1" #> [1] "attr1"  h5_delete_attr(file, "data", "attr1") print(h5_ls_attr(file, "data")) # character(0) #> character(0) unlink(file)

title: Delete an HDF5 Dataset — h5_delete_dataset
text: Deletes dataset HDF5 file. function delete group.

title: Delete an HDF5 Dataset — h5_delete_dataset
code: h5_delete_dataset(file, name)

title: Delete an HDF5 Dataset — h5_delete_dataset
text: file Path HDF5 file. name full path dataset delete.

title: Delete an HDF5 Dataset — h5_delete_dataset
text: Invisibly returns NULL. function called side effects.

title: Delete an HDF5 Dataset — h5_delete_dataset
code: file <- tempfile(fileext = ".h5") h5_write(file, "dset1", 1:10) h5_write(file, "dset2", 1:5) print(h5_ls(file)) #> [1] "dset1" "dset2"  h5_delete_dataset(file, "dset1") print(h5_ls(file)) #> [1] "dset2" unlink(file)

title: Delete an HDF5 Group — h5_delete_group
text: Deletes group objects contained within . function delete dataset.

title: Delete an HDF5 Group — h5_delete_group
code: h5_delete_group(file, name)

title: Delete an HDF5 Group — h5_delete_group
text: file Path HDF5 file. name full path group delete (e.g., "/g1/g2").

title: Delete an HDF5 Group — h5_delete_group
text: Invisibly returns NULL. function called side effects.

title: Delete an HDF5 Group — h5_delete_group
code: file <- tempfile(fileext = ".h5") h5_write(file, "/g1/g2/dset", 1:10) print(h5_ls(file, recursive = TRUE)) # "g1" "g1/g2" "g1/g2/dset" #> [1] "g1"         "g1/g2"      "g1/g2/dset"  h5_delete_group(file, "/g1") print(h5_ls(file, recursive = TRUE)) # character(0) #> character(0) unlink(file)

title: Get HDF5 Object Dimensions — h5_dim
text: Returns dimensions dataset integer vector. dimensions match R-style (column-major) interpretation.

title: Get HDF5 Object Dimensions — h5_dim
code: h5_dim(file, name)

title: Get HDF5 Object Dimensions — h5_dim
text: file Path HDF5 file. name Name dataset.

title: Get HDF5 Object Dimensions — h5_dim
text: integer vector dimensions, integer(0) scalars.

title: Get HDF5 Object Dimensions — h5_dim
code: file <- tempfile(fileext = ".h5")  mat <- matrix(1:10, nrow = 2, ncol = 5) h5_write(file, "matrix", mat)  # Check dims without reading the whole dataset h5_dim(file, "matrix") # Returns c(2, 5) #> [1] 2 5  unlink(file)

title: Get HDF5 Attribute Dimensions — h5_dim_attr
text: Returns dimensions attribute.

title: Get HDF5 Attribute Dimensions — h5_dim_attr
code: h5_dim_attr(file, name, attribute)

title: Get HDF5 Attribute Dimensions — h5_dim_attr
text: file Path HDF5 file. name Name object attached . attribute Name attribute.

title: Get HDF5 Attribute Dimensions — h5_dim_attr
text: integer vector dimensions, integer(0) scalars.

title: Get HDF5 Attribute Dimensions — h5_dim_attr
code: file <- tempfile(fileext = ".h5") h5_write(file, "data", 1)  h5_write_attr(file, "data", "vec_attr", 1:10) h5_dim_attr(file, "data", "vec_attr") # 10 #> [1] 10  unlink(file)

what: Check if an HDF5 File or Object Exists — h5_exists
title: Check if an HDF5 File or Object Exists — h5_exists
text: Safely checks file valid HDF5 file specific object (group dataset) exists within valid HDF5 file.

title: Check if an HDF5 File or Object Exists — h5_exists
code: h5_exists(file, name = "/")

title: Check if an HDF5 File or Object Exists — h5_exists
text: file Path HDF5 file. name full path object check (e.g., "/data/matrix"). Defaults "/", tests file valid HDF5 file.

title: Check if an HDF5 File or Object Exists — h5_exists
text: logical value: TRUE file/object exists valid, FALSE otherwise.

title: Check if an HDF5 File or Object Exists — h5_exists
text: function provides robust, error-free way test existence. Testing File: name / (default), function checks file valid, readable HDF5 file. return FALSE non-existent files, non-HDF5 files, corrupted files without raising error. Testing Object: name path (e.g., /data/matrix), function first confirms file valid HDF5, checks specific object exists within .

title: Check if an HDF5 File or Object Exists — h5_exists
code: file <- tempfile(fileext = ".h5") h5_write(file, "my_data", 1:10)  # --- Test 1: Check for a specific object --- h5_exists(file, "my_data") # TRUE #> [1] TRUE h5_exists(file, "nonexistent_data") # FALSE #> [1] FALSE  # --- Test 2: Check for a valid HDF5 file --- h5_exists(file) # TRUE #> [1] TRUE h5_exists(file, "/") # TRUE #> [1] TRUE  # --- Test 3: Check invalid or non-existent files --- h5_exists("not_a_real_file.h5") # FALSE #> [1] FALSE  text_file <- tempfile() writeLines("this is not hdf5", text_file) h5_exists(text_file) # FALSE #> [1] FALSE  # Check for an object in an invalid file (also FALSE) h5_exists(text_file, "my_data") # FALSE #> [1] FALSE  unlink(file) unlink(text_file)

what: Check if an HDF5 Attribute Exists — h5_exists_attr
title: Check if an HDF5 Attribute Exists — h5_exists_attr
text: Checks existence attribute HDF5 object without raising error exist.

title: Check if an HDF5 Attribute Exists — h5_exists_attr
code: h5_exists_attr(file, name, attribute)

title: Check if an HDF5 Attribute Exists — h5_exists_attr
text: file Path HDF5 file. name path object (dataset group). attribute name attribute check.

title: Check if an HDF5 Attribute Exists — h5_exists_attr
text: logical value: TRUE attribute exists, FALSE otherwise.

title: Check if an HDF5 Attribute Exists — h5_exists_attr
code: file <- tempfile(fileext = ".h5") h5_write(file, "my_data", 1) h5_write_attr(file, "my_data", "units", "meters")  h5_exists_attr(file, "my_data", "units") # TRUE #> [1] TRUE h5_exists_attr(file, "my_data", "nonexistent_attr") # FALSE #> [1] FALSE  unlink(file)

what: Check if an HDF5 Object is a Dataset — h5_is_dataset
title: Check if an HDF5 Object is a Dataset — h5_is_dataset
text: Checks object given path dataset.

title: Check if an HDF5 Object is a Dataset — h5_is_dataset
code: h5_is_dataset(file, name)

title: Check if an HDF5 Object is a Dataset — h5_is_dataset
text: file Path HDF5 file. name full path object check.

title: Check if an HDF5 Object is a Dataset — h5_is_dataset
text: logical value: TRUE object exists dataset, FALSE otherwise (group, exist).

title: Check if an HDF5 Object is a Dataset — h5_is_dataset
code: file <- tempfile(fileext = ".h5") h5_create_group(file, "my_group") h5_write(file, "my_dataset", 1)  h5_is_dataset(file, "my_dataset") # TRUE #> [1] TRUE h5_is_dataset(file, "my_group") # FALSE #> [1] FALSE h5_is_dataset(file, "nonexistent") # FALSE #> [1] FALSE  unlink(file)

what: Check if an HDF5 Object is a Group — h5_is_group
title: Check if an HDF5 Object is a Group — h5_is_group
text: Checks object given path group.

title: Check if an HDF5 Object is a Group — h5_is_group
code: h5_is_group(file, name)

title: Check if an HDF5 Object is a Group — h5_is_group
text: file Path HDF5 file. name full path object check.

title: Check if an HDF5 Object is a Group — h5_is_group
text: logical value: TRUE object exists group, FALSE otherwise (dataset, exist).

title: Check if an HDF5 Object is a Group — h5_is_group
code: file <- tempfile(fileext = ".h5") h5_create_group(file, "my_group") h5_write(file, "my_dataset", 1)  h5_is_group(file, "my_group") # TRUE #> [1] TRUE h5_is_group(file, "my_dataset") # FALSE #> [1] FALSE h5_is_group(file, "nonexistent") # FALSE #> [1] FALSE  unlink(file)

title: List HDF5 Objects — h5_ls
text: Lists names objects (datasets groups) within HDF5 file group.

title: List HDF5 Objects — h5_ls
code: h5_ls(file, name = "/", recursive = TRUE, full.names = FALSE)

title: List HDF5 Objects — h5_ls
text: file Path HDF5 file. name group path start listing . Defaults root group (/). recursive TRUE (default), lists objects found recursively name. FALSE, lists immediate children. full.names TRUE, full paths file's root returned. FALSE (default), names relative name.

title: List HDF5 Objects — h5_ls
text: character vector object names. name / (default), paths relative root file. name another group, paths relative group (unless full.names = TRUE).

title: List HDF5 Objects — h5_ls
code: file <- tempfile(fileext = ".h5")  # Create some nested objects h5_write(file, "g1/d1", 1) h5_write(file, "g1/g2/d2", 2)  # List recursively from the root (default) h5_ls(file) # c("g1", "g1/d1", "g1/g2", "g1/g2/d2") #> [1] "g1"       "g1/d1"    "g1/g2"    "g1/g2/d2"  # List recursively from a subgroup h5_ls(file, name = "g1") # c("d1", "g2", "g2/d2") #> [1] "d1"    "g2"    "g2/d2"  unlink(file)

title: List HDF5 Attributes — h5_ls_attr
text: Lists names attributes attached specific HDF5 object.

title: List HDF5 Attributes — h5_ls_attr
code: h5_ls_attr(file, name)

title: List HDF5 Attributes — h5_ls_attr
text: file Path HDF5 file. name path object (dataset group) query. Use / file's root attributes.

title: List HDF5 Attributes — h5_ls_attr
text: character vector attribute names.

what: Move or Rename an HDF5 Object — h5_move
title: Move or Rename an HDF5 Object — h5_move
text: Moves renames object (dataset, group, etc.) within HDF5 file.

title: Move or Rename an HDF5 Object — h5_move
code: h5_move(file, from, to)

title: Move or Rename an HDF5 Object — h5_move
text: file Path HDF5 file. current (source) path object (e.g., "/group/data"). new (destination) path object (e.g., "/group/data_new").

title: Move or Rename an HDF5 Object — h5_move
text: function called side-effect returns NULL invisibly.

title: Move or Rename an HDF5 Object — h5_move
text: function provides efficient, low-level wrapper HDF5 library's H5Lmove function. metadata-operation, meaning data read rewritten. makes extremely fast, even large datasets. can use function either rename object within group (e.g., "data/old" "data/new") move object different group (e.g., "data/old" "archive/old"). destination parent group automatically created exist.

title: Move or Rename an HDF5 Object — h5_move
code: file <- tempfile(fileext = ".h5")  # Create a sample file structure h5_write(file, "group1/dataset_a", 1:10) h5_write(file, "group1/dataset_b", 2:20) h5_create_group(file, "group2")  # --- Example 1: Rename a dataset ---  print(h5_ls(file, recursive = TRUE)) #> [1] "group1"           "group1/dataset_a" "group1/dataset_b" "group2"           #> [1] "group1"           "group1/dataset_a" "group1/dataset_b" "group2"  h5_move(file, "group1/dataset_a", "group1/data_renamed")  print(h5_ls(file, recursive = TRUE)) #> [1] "group1"              "group1/data_renamed" "group1/dataset_b"    #> [4] "group2"              #> [1] "group1"              "group1/dataset_b"  "group1/data_renamed" "group2"   # --- Example 2: Move a dataset between groups ---  h5_move(file, "group1/dataset_b", "group2/data_moved")  print(h5_ls(file, recursive = TRUE)) #> [1] "group1"              "group1/data_renamed" "group2"              #> [4] "group2/data_moved"   #> [1] "group1"              "group1/data_renamed" "group2" #> [4] "group2/data_moved"  # Clean up unlink(file)

title: Read an HDF5 Object — h5_read
text: Reads dataset group HDF5 file R object.

title: Read an HDF5 Object — h5_read
code: h5_read(file, name, attrs = FALSE)

title: Read an HDF5 Object — h5_read
text: file Path HDF5 file. name Name dataset group read (e.g., "/data/matrix"). attrs Controls HDF5 attributes read attached R object. Can FALSE (default), TRUE (attributes), character vector attribute names include (e.g., c("info", "version")), character vector names exclude, prefixed - (e.g., c("-class")). Non-existent attributes silently skipped.

title: Read an HDF5 Object — h5_read
text: numeric, character, factor, raw, data.frame name dataset. nested list name group.

title: Read an HDF5 Object — h5_read
text: name points dataset, h5_read converts corresponding R object: Numeric datasets read numeric (double) prevent overflow. String datasets read character. Enum datasets read factor. 1-byte Opaque datasets read raw. Compound datasets read data.frame. Dimensions preserved transposed match R's column-major order.

title: Read an HDF5 Object — h5_read
text: name points group, h5_read read recursively, creating corresponding nested R list. makes easy read complex, structured data single command. HDF5 groups read R lists. Datasets within group read R objects described . HDF5 attributes group attached R attributes list. elements returned list sorted alphabetically name.

title: Read an HDF5 Object — h5_read
code: file <- tempfile(fileext = ".h5")  # --- Reading Datasets --- h5_write(file, "my_matrix", matrix(1:4, 2)) h5_write(file, "my_factor", factor(c("a", "b")))  mat <- h5_read(file, "my_matrix") fac <- h5_read(file, "my_factor")  # --- Reading Groups --- h5_write(file, "/config/version", 1.2) h5_write(file, "/config/user", "test") h5_write_attr(file, "/config", "info", "settings")  # Read the 'config' group into a list config_list <- h5_read(file, "config") str(config_list) #> List of 2 #>  $ user   : chr "test" #>  $ version: num 1.2  # Read the entire file from the root all_content <- h5_read(file, "/") str(all_content) #> List of 3 #>  $ config   :List of 2 #>   ..$ user   : chr "test" #>   ..$ version: num 1.2 #>  $ my_factor: Factor w/ 2 levels "a","b": 1 2 #>  $ my_matrix: num [1:2, 1:2] 1 2 3 4  # --- Round-tripping with Attributes --- named_vec <- c(a = 1, b = 2) h5_write(file, "named_vec", named_vec, attrs = TRUE)  # Read back with attrs = TRUE to restore names vec_rt <- h5_read(file, "named_vec", attrs = TRUE) all.equal(named_vec, vec_rt) #> [1] TRUE  unlink(file)

title: Read an HDF5 Attribute — h5_read_attr
text: Reads attribute associated HDF5 object (dataset group).

title: Read an HDF5 Attribute — h5_read_attr
code: h5_read_attr(file, name, attribute)

title: Read an HDF5 Attribute — h5_read_attr
text: file Path HDF5 file. name Name object (dataset group) attribute attached . attribute Name attribute read.

title: Read an HDF5 Attribute — h5_read_attr
text: numeric, character, factor, raw vector/array.

title: Read an HDF5 Attribute — h5_read_attr
text: Numeric attributes read numeric (double). String attributes read character. enum attributes read factor. 1-byte opaque attributes read raw.

title: Read an HDF5 Attribute — h5_read_attr
code: file <- tempfile(fileext = ".h5")  # Create a dataset to attach attributes to h5_write(file, "dset", 1)  # Write attributes of different types h5_write_attr(file, "dset", "a_string", "some metadata") h5_write_attr(file, "dset", "a_vector", c(1.1, 2.2))  # Read them back str_attr <- h5_read_attr(file, "dset", "a_string") vec_attr <- h5_read_attr(file, "dset", "a_vector")  print(str_attr) #> [1] "some metadata" print(vec_attr) #> [1] 1.1 2.2 unlink(file)

what: Display the Structure of an HDF5 Object — h5_str
title: Display the Structure of an HDF5 Object — h5_str
text: Recursively prints summary HDF5 group dataset, similar structure h5ls -r. displays nested structure, object types, dimensions, attributes.

title: Display the Structure of an HDF5 Object — h5_str
code: h5_str(file, name = "/")

title: Display the Structure of an HDF5 Object — h5_str
text: file Path HDF5 file. name name group dataset display. Defaults root group "/".

title: Display the Structure of an HDF5 Object — h5_str
text: function called side-effect printing console returns NULL invisibly.

title: Display the Structure of an HDF5 Object — h5_str
text: function provides quick convenient way inspect contents HDF5 file. performs recursive traversal file C-level prints formatted summary R console. function read data R. inspects metadata (names, types, dimensions) objects file, making fast memory-safe arbitrarily large files.

title: Display the Structure of an HDF5 Object — h5_str
code: file <- tempfile(fileext = ".h5")  # Create a nested structure h5_write(file, "/config/version", I(1.2)) h5_write(file, "/data/matrix", matrix(1:4, 2, 2)) h5_write_attr(file, "/data/matrix", "title", "my matrix")  # Display the structure of the entire file h5_str(file) #> Listing contents of: /tmp/RtmpCnQhJl/file4e7324b001e7.h5 #> Root group: / #> ---------------------------------------------------------------- #> Type         Name #> ---------------------------------------------------------------- #> Group        config #> float64      config/version #> Group        data #> uint8[2,2]   data/matrix #> string[1]    data/matrix @title  unlink(file)

title: Get HDF5 Object Type — h5_typeof
text: Returns low-level HDF5 storage type dataset (e.g., "int8", "float64", "string"). allows inspecting file storage type reading data R.

title: Get HDF5 Object Type — h5_typeof
code: h5_typeof(file, name)

title: Get HDF5 Object Type — h5_typeof
text: file Path HDF5 file. name Name dataset.

title: Get HDF5 Object Type — h5_typeof
text: character string representing HDF5 storage type (e.g., "float32", "uint32", "string").

title: Get HDF5 Object Type — h5_typeof
code: file <- tempfile(fileext = ".h5")  # Write integers h5_write(file, "integers", 1:5) # Write doubles h5_write(file, "doubles", c(1.1, 2.2))  # Check types h5_typeof(file, "integers") # "uint8" (auto-selected) #> [1] "uint8" h5_typeof(file, "doubles")  # "float64" (auto-selected) #> [1] "float64"  unlink(file)

title: Get HDF5 Attribute Type — h5_typeof_attr
text: Returns low-level HDF5 storage type attribute.

title: Get HDF5 Attribute Type — h5_typeof_attr
code: h5_typeof_attr(file, name, attribute)

title: Get HDF5 Attribute Type — h5_typeof_attr
text: file Path HDF5 file. name Name object attached . attribute Name attribute.

title: Get HDF5 Attribute Type — h5_typeof_attr
text: character string representing HDF5 storage type.

title: Get HDF5 Attribute Type — h5_typeof_attr
code: file <- tempfile(fileext = ".h5") h5_write(file, "data", 1)  h5_write_attr(file, "data", "meta", I("info")) h5_typeof_attr(file, "data", "meta") # "string" #> [1] "string"  unlink(file)

what: Write an R Object to HDF5 — h5_write
title: Write an R Object to HDF5 — h5_write
text: Writes R object HDF5 file, creating file exist. function can write atomic vectors, matrices, arrays, factors, data.frames, nested lists.

title: Write an R Object to HDF5 — h5_write
code: h5_write(file, name, data, dtype = "auto", compress = TRUE, attrs = FALSE)

title: Write an R Object to HDF5 — h5_write
text: file Path HDF5 file. name Name dataset (e.g., "/data/matrix"). data R object write. Supported: numeric, integer, logical, character, factor, raw, data.frame, nested lists. dtype target HDF5 data type. See details. compress logical integer 0-9. TRUE, compression level 5 used. FALSE 0, compression used. integer 1-9 specifies zlib compression level directly. attrs Controls R attributes data written HDF5 object. Can FALSE (default), TRUE (attributes except dim), character vector attribute names include (e.g., c("info", "version")), character vector names exclude, prefixed - (e.g., c("-class")).

title: Write an R Object to HDF5 — h5_write
text: Invisibly returns file. function called side effects.

title: Write an R Object to HDF5 — h5_write
text: default, h5_write saves single-element vectors 1-dimensional arrays. write true HDF5 scalar, wrap value () treat "-." example, h5_write(file, "x", (5)) create scalar dataset, h5_write(file, "x", 5) create 1D array length 1.

title: Write an R Object to HDF5 — h5_write
text: data list (data.frame), h5_write write recursively, creating corresponding group dataset structure. R list objects created HDF5 groups. supported R objects (vectors, matrices, arrays, factors, data.frames) written HDF5 datasets. Attributes list written HDF5 attributes corresponding group. writing, "dry run" performed validate objects attributes within list writeable type. part structure invalid, function throw error data written.

title: Write an R Object to HDF5 — h5_write
text: data.frame objects written HDF5 compound datasets. native HDF5 table-like structure highly efficient portable.

title: Write an R Object to HDF5 — h5_write
text: dtype argument controls -disk storage type numeric data . dtype set "auto" (default), h5lite automatically select space-efficient HDF5 type numeric data can safely represent full range values. example, writing 1:100 result 8-bit unsigned integer (uint8) dataset, helps minimize file size. override behavior, can specify exact type. input case-insensitive allows unambiguous partial matching. full list supported values : "auto", "float", "double" "float16", "float32", "float64" "int8", "int16", "int32", "int64" "uint8", "uint16", "uint32", "uint64" "char", "short", "int", "long", "llong" "uchar", "ushort", "uint", "ulong", "ullong" Note: Types without bit-width suffix (e.g., "int", "long") system- dependent may different sizes different machines. maximum file portability, recommended use types explicit bit-widths (e.g., "int32"). non-numeric data (character, factor, raw, logical), storage type determined automatically changed dtype argument. R logical vectors stored 8-bit unsigned integers (uint8), HDF5 native boolean datatype.

title: Write an R Object to HDF5 — h5_write
text: properly round-trip R object, helpful set attrs = TRUE. preserves important R metadata—names named vector, row.names data.frame, class object—HDF5 attributes. Limitation: HDF5 direct analog R's dimnames. Attempting write object dimnames (e.g., named matrix) attrs = TRUE result error. must either remove dimnames set attrs = FALSE.

title: Write an R Object to HDF5 — h5_write
code: file <- tempfile(fileext = ".h5")  # Write a simple vector (dtype is auto-detected as uint8) h5_write(file, "vec1", 1:20) h5_typeof(file, "vec1") # "uint8" #> [1] "uint8"  # Write a matrix, letting h5_write determine dimensions mat <- matrix(rnorm(12), nrow = 4, ncol = 3) h5_write(file, "group/mat", mat) h5_dim(file, "group/mat") # c(4, 3) #> [1] 4 3  # Overwrite the first vector, forcing a 32-bit integer type h5_write(file, "vec1", 101:120, dtype = "int32") h5_typeof(file, "vec1") # "int32" #> [1] "int32"  # Write a scalar value h5_write(file, "scalar", I(3.14))  # Write a named vector and preserve its names by setting attrs = TRUE named_vec <- c(a = 1, b = 2) h5_write(file, "named_vector", named_vec, attrs = TRUE)  # Write a nested list, which creates groups and datasets my_list <- list(   config = list(version = 1.2, user = "test"),   data = matrix(1:4, 2) ) attr(my_list, "info") <- "Session data" h5_write(file, "session_data", my_list)  h5_ls(file, recursive = TRUE) #>  [1] "group"                       "group/mat"                   #>  [3] "named_vector"                "scalar"                      #>  [5] "session_data"                "session_data/config"         #>  [7] "session_data/config/user"    "session_data/config/version" #>  [9] "session_data/data"           "vec1"                         unlink(file)

what: Write an Attribute to HDF5 — h5_write_attr
title: Write an Attribute to HDF5 — h5_write_attr
text: Writes R object attribute existing HDF5 object.

title: Write an Attribute to HDF5 — h5_write_attr
code: h5_write_attr(file, name, attribute, data, dtype = "auto")

title: Write an Attribute to HDF5 — h5_write_attr
text: file Path HDF5 file. name Name object attach attribute (e.g., "/data"). attribute name attribute create. data R object write. Supported: numeric, integer, logical, character, raw, data.frame. dtype target HDF5 data type. Defaults typeof(data).

title: Write an Attribute to HDF5 — h5_write_attr
text: Invisibly returns NULL. function called side effects.

title: Write an Attribute to HDF5 — h5_write_attr
text: dtype argument controls -disk storage type numeric data . dtype set "auto" (default), h5lite automatically select space-efficient type numeric data can safely represent full range values. example, writing 1:100 result 8-bit unsigned integer (uint8) attribute. override numeric data, can specify exact type. input case-insensitive allows unambiguous partial matching. full list supported values : "auto", "float", "double" "float16", "float32", "float64" "int8", "int16", "int32", "int64" "uint8", "uint16", "uint32", "uint64" "char", "short", "int", "long", "llong" "uchar", "ushort", "uint", "ulong", "ullong" Note: Types without bit-width suffix (e.g., "int", "long") system- dependent may different sizes different machines. maximum file portability, recommended use types explicit widths (e.g., "int32"). non-numeric data (character, factor, raw, logical), storage type determined automatically changed dtype argument. R logical vectors stored 8-bit unsigned integers (uint8), HDF5 native boolean datatype. data.frame objects written HDF5 compound attributes, native table-like structure. write scalar attribute, wrap value () (e.g., ("meters")). Otherwise, dimensions inferred automatically.

title: Write an Attribute to HDF5 — h5_write_attr
code: file <- tempfile(fileext = ".h5")  # First, create an object to attach attributes to h5_write(file, "my_data", 1:10, compress = FALSE)  # Write a scalar string attribute h5_write_attr(file, "my_data", "units", I("meters"))  # Write a numeric vector attribute h5_write_attr(file, "my_data", "range", c(0, 100))  # List attributes to confirm they were written h5_ls_attr(file, "my_data") #> [1] "units" "range"  unlink(file)

what: h5lite: A Simple and Lightweight HDF5 Interface — h5lite-package
title: h5lite: A Simple and Lightweight HDF5 Interface — h5lite-package
text: h5lite package provides simple, lightweight, user-friendly interface reading writing HDF5 files. designed R users want save load common R objects (vectors, matrices, arrays, factors, data.frames) HDF5 file without needing understand low-level details HDF5 C API.

title: h5lite: A Simple and Lightweight HDF5 Interface — h5lite-package
text: Simple API: Use familiar functions like h5_read() h5_write(). Automatic Handling: Dimensions, data types, group creation handled automatically. Safe Default: Numeric data read double prevent integer overflow. Easy Installation: required HDF5 library bundled package.

title: h5lite: A Simple and Lightweight HDF5 Interface — h5lite-package
text: Maintainer: Daniel P. Smith dansmith01@gmail.com
